ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Bhairabi club is working in the state of orissa since 1977.The organisation working for the welfare of the weaker section of the society in Khordha, Nayagarh, Ganjam, Puri and Boudh. The major activities of the organisation are as follows. 1. Home for the Aged 2. Multi Service Care Centre for Older persons 3.Integrated Rehabiliation Centre for Addicts in Khordha and Ganjam District. 4. HIV/AIDS programme in Ganjam and Khordha District. 5.Special School for MR / VI / HI 6. Community Based Rehabilitation Programme for PWDs 7. Vocational Training for PWDs 8. Rehabilitation of Leprosy Cured Persons( Home for the Leprosy Cured Persons ) 9.Distribution of Aids and Appliances to the PWDs ( ADIP) 10. Remote Area Funding in Boudh District. 11. Residential Primary School for STs in Nayagarh Dist. 12. Residential Primary School for SCs in Nayagarh Dist. 13. Short Stay Home for women and girls 14. Swadhar Shelter for women in difficult circumstances. 15. Ujjawala for victims of trafficking women and children. 16. Disaster Risk management programme in Puri and Khordha district. 17. Creche Programme 18. Rural Sanitation programme 19. Health programme 20. Orphanage 21. Consumer welfare 22. Legal aid awareness programme 23.SHG promotion 24. Mushroom cultivation 25.Horticulture 26.Pischiculture 27. Environement awareness programme 28.Formal and Non formal education 29.Vocational training for youth 30.National Child labour special school 31. Women help line The organisation successfully implementing all the above programmes and achieve its goal. Best Achievements. 1.Best NGO Award from Collector, Khordha 2. Red & white Bravey award from Godfrey Phillips India Limited, New Delhi 3. State Youth Award from Chief Minister, Orissa

Sansad Adarsh Gram Yojana (SAGY) is a rural development programme focused on the social and cultural development of villages. SAGY envisages the development of model villages, called Adarsh Grams, through the implementation of existing schemes, and certain new initiatives to be designed for the local context, which may vary from village to village and creating models of local development which can be replicated in other villages.

It is an institute of dance and music. It is one of a kind, situated in the temple city of the eastern coast, Bhubaneswar. With learning facilities for both Indian and foreign peoples, Bimohana strives to practice and popularise Odissi dance from the very corner of Odisha to the vibrant capitals of the world.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Institution â€“ Binapani jubak sangha (BJS), was formulated by 30 village Youths in the village Batpondugandi on dated 1602074 (1974) for village development and development of poor villagers. After formulation of the Youth Center, BJS, it has been started its activities in the village and nearby villages on Adult Education & literacy, Agriculture, Horticulture, beekeeping, Animal husbandry, Pisciculture, Soil conservation, Cottage Industries, Forestry, Child & women Development, Youth development, Housing & Tribal Development, Small Savings, Sericulture and so on allied social welfare activities in the village and nearby villages for the socio economic upliftment of poor. On the other hand with its afore said activities steps were taken up by the founder Member to Register the Institution by the same time and got it Registered under the societies Registration Act XXI of 1860 on dated 2.9.1978 bearing its Registration No. 13907/751 of 1978-79 it has also got it registration under the foreign Contributation Regulation Act 1976 bearing its Registration No. 104990005 dated 18.3.1985 and Strengthened its all constitutional activities as stated above for national development. At Present its activities have been predominated in the areas of its operation in the District with the aid and assistance of benevolent members, different Bodies, Govt and non Government Agencies Departments, National and inter national Agencies on the socio economic status of poor. The Institution has achieved Adult Education Project, Non formal Education Project for elementary age group of 6-14 Years of age, Child welfare project, Gurugudia Tribal Development project, Regional seed Bank, Village library, social forestry & Environment Programme, Sericulture programme, Horticulture programme, Agriculture programme, Fishery programme and so on small and big programmes and projects as per financial statement enclosed in separately for reference the Institution have constructed 31 houses in village Batpondugondi & Anukulpur village. on the other hand the Institution have also Established and achive Secondary Education School At Gurugudia village inside the Shimilipal forest range for education of hilly children the Institution have got A4.28 acres of land at Barehipani village, for Harbalgarden A1.29 cre at Badnai village for adalt education and Literesy programme and a3.00 cres land at Gurugudia village for its Secondary Education School it has also got a0.71decimals of at Batpondugandi village for Community Rollway Station and A0.54 decimals Agriculture project in the village which is under progress. The Institution B.J.S. has been affiliated with Bharat Sebak Samaj â€“B.S.S. and Started the Primary education teacher training and Anganwadi Supervisor & workers training and Prompted the Rural development activities for National Development

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Service for the Unreached and Unfortunate Children of poor Prisoners Very innocent children bear the unbearable sorrows and sufferings when the earning members of the families become the members of Crime World involving themselves into different type of crimes. To save the children and their unfortunate and helpless mothers John Augustus Organisation extends the hand and heart to serve the Prison World taking care of the education of children of poor convicts of entire State Jails since 2003. John Augustus Prison and Social Welfare Services for first time in Odisha thought for the education of helpless and unfortunate children of poor convicts of State Jails. The views of the Organisation are very simple but noble. We tried our best to bring back the peace and happiness of the family members of convicts to which they missed. The people who committed the crime, their loving world turned to four walls of Jail. But their innocent children and their family members became the real victim of series of sorrows and sufferings. We support the innocent children of the Convicts who suffer more having no offence of theirs. We want to make them at least Matriculate and to make them good citizen of the society. To add to this, from the year 2010, we have supported the children of long term U.T. prisoners of different jails of the State providing them Text Books and Study Materials as in case of convicts. During the year 2016-17, 147 children of prisoners became Matriculate. John Augustus Organisation at first took the charge of education of children of poor convicts during the year 2003. We are now covering the entire State Jails and the year-wise children we supported with Text Books, Study Materials and Matriculation Exam. Fee is as follows 2003 - 126 , 2004 - 205, 2005 - 330, 2006 - 363, 2007 - 440, 2008 - 608, 2009 - 1040 , 2010 - 1549, 2011 - 1688, 2012 - 1815, 2013 - 1830, 2014 - 1905, 2015 - 1965 2016 - 1846 By this an unfortunate mother of a helpless child is definitely happy that her child is being cared by someone, even in the absence of the father whose world is limited to four walls only. On the other hand the prisoners are equally happy that their children are reading in the absence of theirs. This is a service which offers mental satisfaction and pleasure at a time to the neglected child, helpless mother and unfortunate father. Our service is dedicated to the Unreached, Unfortunate and Distressed group of our Society.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Kalinga Foundation Trust(KFT) was founded by the Legendary Late Biju Patnaik, the former Chief Minister of Orissa and former Union Minister, Govt of India. The innovative idea of extracting petrol from cola was the brain child of Sri Patnaik and he implemented this Project through KFT by sending six bright young Indian Students to Paris for research on the subject. The objective of the Trust are Public Charitable & Literacy, viz; to diffuse useful knowledge in arts, science, scientific research, and promotion of literature. To organise relief works in time of food, famine, earthquake, cyclone, fire and such other natural calamities. To promote encourage foreign studies and research by Indian students; to provide medical and welfare facilities to the children, disable persons and the destitutes. To provide stipends, scholarships, grants for enabling meritorious and deserving students to prosecute higher studies in India. All the above objectives are being implemented by KFT for the last 60 years.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Eduction to tribal and minor communities through all round education and tribal upliftment. Kalinga Institute of Social Sciences (KISS), Bhubaneswar - the biggest Residential Tribal Institute in South Asia that provides Free Accommodation, Food, Healthcare and Education from Standard-I to Post Graduation level and all basic amenities of life absolutely free with a job assurance after completion of education and vocational training. Orissa is regarded as the second largest tribal populated state after Madhya Pradesh. Orissa is recorded to accumulate 62 tribal community and out of them 13 are regarded to be the primitive tribal group. Every tribe has its uniqueness in daily and social tradition and customs. Students of this institute have proved their superiority not only in academic but in other field of activities like sports, music and other extra curricular field and the achievements are phenomenal Besides educating the students the Institute has taken up the responsibility of empowering them with various technical knowledge. It envisages to make them self sufficient in future. With this aim the Institute has been providing vocational training, computer knowledge etc. There by the students have been getting knowledge on Knitting, appliquÃ©, horticulture, Pisciculture etc. The vocational unit has also been preparing candle and phenyl for internal and external consumption. The Institute has its own research unit that carry out various research studies to strengthen and provide right knowledge and activities to enrich various innovative programmes in the institute. Considering the health situation and requirements of 25000 students the Institute has been providing all time health care facilities by appointing efficient doctors, nurses and attendants. The Institute has a full fledged dispensary within its campus.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Background â€œKARTABYAâ€ is a group of new generations who spontaneously donate their leisure and labour for the cause of those who spend their every moment of live through appetite, insanitation, illiteracy, ignorance and poverty. The organization has got its establishment to materialize the dedicated and volunteer attitude of development professionals for the cause of society. Areas of Action â–º Socio â€“ economic upliftment of street and slum children. â–º Capacity building and empowering the tribal and rural poor. â–º Women empowerment â–º Rural healthy and sanitation â–º Revival of traditional health system. â–º Environment protection. â–º Self-employment training programme in tribal and rural areas. â–º Impact assessment on development interventions COMPOSITE CENTER FOR THE SLUM AND WORKING CHILDREN Community sharing â€¢ Entire project activity shared among the slum people so that they became aware on the objectives and expected outcome of the project. â€¢ Inputs from the community and the target parents are taken for the sustainability of the project. â€¢ It was suggested in the community sharing that the targeted slum children need to be enumerated to know the overall status of the slum children. Formation of committee â€¢ A parent committee is being formed in the community. The committee sits once in a month to discuss the underlying problems and possible solutions of checking the slum children from child labour. â€¢ Discussions are also made on the issues of street children and what are the step scan be undertaken to check the vulnerability of the street children. It was also discussed in the meeting that part of the activity of the composite center of the slum children should be made for the street children. Education and Main streaming â€¢ A community school is running in the slum where 100 children are getting education. Each child is being facilitated for continuation of education. Efforts are being undertaken to mainstream the slum children into the formal education system. Vocational training programme â€¢ The vocational need and capacity is identified among the targeted children. Those are eligible to get the vocational training; they are given training on tailoring and appliquÃ©. â€¢ Some of the children are also given training on plumbing and carpentry. â€¢ Counseling are provided to the parents of the targeted children through a psychologist/counselor of the organization regarding exploitation of children and not to engage them in the wage related activities. Health check up â€¢ Regular health checks up camps are being organized for the slum and street children in the target area. Primary treatments are provided to the children during the camp. CAPACITY BUILDING PROGRAMME FOR THE PRIS It is evident that Panchayati Raj Institutions (PRIs) are the key stakeholders in the development process of the state as well as the country. They are placed in an important place which relates the community needs with the government development programmes. Due to lack of capacity of the PRI members and interest on the part of Government officials, PRI functionaries are not able to exercise their power to a great extent. This was the finding from the workshop on PRI, which was conducted in project locations of Keonhar and Nuapara District. The participants of the workshop were the PRI functionaries, community leader and Govt. officials who provided valuable opinions on effective functioning of Panchayats in the state. TRAINING AND CAPACITY BUILDING OF WOMEN In our recent modern society women find little or no space to assert their rights. Their situation is also more vulnerable in the context of globalization. They always fall back in realizing the ultimate outcome of every socio-economic development initiatives undertaken by different agencies. Apart from that there are number of taboos exists in the society which prevents them participate in every sphere of work and also they are not prioritized in compared to male counterparts. Looking into this background the organization has organized a mass community awareness programme on empowerment. The resource persons of the programme conveyed the message on the available entitlements for the women groups and how they can access those benefits without any sort of hurdles. Apart from this they were also oriented on the official procedure on getting those benefits. The outcome of the activity helped the women group to access the schemes implemented by different agencies. Already formed 52 Self-help groups were invited into different phases. They got trained on the book keeping mechanism and they also got the knowledge on the vocational training. There were also subjects covering the marking of the available local products. BRIDGE COURSE PROGRAMME FOR OUT-OF-SCHOOL CHILDREN With an objective to provide education to the out-of-school children, the organization has been assigned by the Govt of orissa to conduct bridge course programme in the slum areas of Bhubaneswar city. In this process, the targeted children are identified with the help of existing education committees of the slum. Thus, the organization has tried to bring the street children into limelight by providing them education, which will enhance their mental ability. At the same time awareness was created among the parents to create demand for education so that they can access basic rights of life. SOCIO-ECONOMIC SURVEY OF THE DISPLACED PERSONS The organization has undertaken a survey of the displaced persons in the nearby areas of the Dhamara port. The objective was to identify the project affected persons to get the compensation amount. The survey questions were prepared by the Dhamara Port Authority, which contained the socio-economic background of the families, their occupational status, land and other details of the target households. Thus based on this survey the authority of the Dhamara port is planning to provide identity cards for the project affected persons so that in future there will be no confusion in receiving compensation amount. CAMPAIGN ON ENVIRONMENT AWARENESS It was felt that environment protection would make the society towards sustainable development. Looking into this the organization has organized a environment awareness campaign with the school students of Bhubaneswar. Students participated in the rally organized by the organization. Leaflets were distributed to create a mass awareness among the general people. There was also a general meeting with the slum community where local resource persons delivered their views on the need for environment protection and how this will save our future generation in the context of growing industrialization. There were also representation of community level leaders, key persons such as teachers and other community members in the general meeting
